conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of light source position.
Shadows are currently cast to the left of the objects.
The light source moves to the right, above the objects.
Shadows will shift to the left as the light source moves to the right.
Shadows will become shorter if the light source moves directly above the objects.
Shadow A (Cake) moves to the left and shortens.
Shadow B (Envelope) moves to the left and shortens.
Shadow C (Scroll) moves to the left and shortens.
Shadow D (Soccer Ball) moves to the left and shortens.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to the left and become shorter.
